page.title: 19Social concerns
page.content: The Government tried to close the {village school}in 1982 when numbers on roll fell to 16 but public opinion was very strong and the school was saved by the personal intervention of the Education Minister.The school population is however kept under review and other small schools have since closed.As there is very little local employment,no new houses and infrequent public transport it is not surprising that the local population is falling. The few houses for sale in the area are expensive for young house buyers.There is now only one shop which is a Post Office and general There is a strong feeling of community in the area.There are many clubs and societies which are popular.The people are proud of the district and there is very little vandalism.
